verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:4
verses.text: And there came a traveller unto the rich man, and he spared to take of his own flock and of his own herd, to dress for the wayfaring man that was come unto him; but took the poor man’s lamb, and dressed it for the man that was come to him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:5
verses.text: And David’s anger was greatly kindled against the man; and he said to Nathan, As the Lord liveth, the man that hath done this thing shall surely die:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:6
verses.text: And he shall restore the lamb fourfold, because he did this thing, and because he had no pity.
